RationalPiano.Input
Class InputDevs

java.lang.Object
  RationalPiano.Input.InputDevs

public class InputDevs
extends java.lang.Object

Manages Input from Mouse, Keyboard and Multitouch. Translates presses to newVoice() and releases to releaseVoice().

Version:
1.0
Author:
Fabian Ehrentraud
Licence:
Licensed under the Open Software License (OSL 3.0)
Date:
2010-07-26

Constructor Detail

InputDevs

public InputDevs(processing.core.PApplet papplet,
                 Voices voices,
                 GraphicControls graphiccontrols,
                 int tuioPort)
Initializes the input management and generates a TUIO UDP receiver

Parameters:
papplet - The processing applet to get the size of for scaling TUIO input
voices - A Voices object for creating new voices and removing old ones
graphiccontrols - A GraphicControls object needed for getting the corresponding note at a given coordinate
tuioPort - The local UDP port the TUIO Listener should listen at
Method Detail

mousePressed

public void mousePressed(int mouseX,
                         int mouseY,
                         int mouseButton)
Hook to be called when a mouse button has been pressed. Creates a new voice that corresponds with the Line at the press coordinates.

Parameters:
mouseX - The X-coordinate position in Pixels on the PApplet window where the mouse button has been pressed at. Leftmost pixel = 0.
mouseY - The Y-coordinate position in Pixels on the PApplet window where the mouse button has been pressed at. Topmost pixel = 0.
mouseButton - An integer representing the mouse button. 37 == left mouse button, 39 == right mouse button, 3 == middle mouse button

mouseReleased

public void mouseReleased(int mouseX,
                          int mouseY,
                          int mouseButton)
Hook to be called when a mouse button has been released. Releases the last via mouse click created voice.

Parameters:
mouseX - The X-coordinate position in Pixels on the PApplet window where the mouse button has been released at. Leftmost pixel = 0.
mouseY - The Y-coordinate position in Pixels on the PApplet window where the mouse button has been released at. Topmost pixel = 0.
mouseButton - An integer representing the mouse button. 37 == left mouse button, 39 == right mouse button, 3 == middle mouse button

keyPressed

public void keyPressed(char key)
Hook for a pressed key on the keyboard. Only reacts to this key if its state was released before (to prevent the OS' setting of auto key repeat from taking negative effect). Creates a new voice that corresponds to that key (see toNote()).

Parameters:
key - The keyboard key's corresponding ASCII character, dependent of the OS' input locale settings.

keyReleased

public void keyReleased(char key)
Hook for a released key on the keyboard. Releases the voice that corresponds to that key (see toNote()).

Parameters:
key - The keyboard key's corresponding ASCII character, dependent of the OS' input locale settings.

toNote

private int toNote(char key)
Converts a keyboard key to the corrensponding midi note. The middle keyboard row (asdf...) is mapped to notes, 'y' corresponds to the leftmost note.

Parameters:
key - The keyboard key of a german layout.
Returns:
The corrensponding midi note.
Warning:
This uses the GERMAN keyboard layout.
